content.text: The diagram shows the graph of \(y = a\sin (bx) + c\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 2\pi\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are positive integers
State the value of \(a\), of \(b\) and of \(c\)
Find the set of values of \(k\) for which the curve \(y = (k + 1)x^{2} - 3x + (k + 1)\) lies below the \(x\)-axis
Show that \(\frac{1 + \sin \theta}{\cos \theta} + \frac{\cos \theta}{1 + \sin \theta} = 2 \sec \theta .\)
Find \(\mathrm{n}(A)\)
Find \(\mathrm{n}(B)\)
Find the elements of \(A \cup B\)
Find the elements of \(A \cap B\)
The sets \(A\) and \(B\) are such that
Find \(\int (9 + \sin 3x)\mathrm{d}x\)
Hence show that \(\int_{\frac{\pi}{9}}^{\pi}(9 + \sin 3x)\mathrm{d}x = a\pi +b\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants to be found.
The function \(\mathrm{f}(x) = a x^{3} + 4 x^{2} + b x - 2\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is such that \(2 x - 1\)
factor. Given that the remainder when \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 2\) is twice the remainder when is divided by \(x + 1\), find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Find how many different 4-digit numbers can be formed from the digits
1, 3, 5, 6, 8 and 9 if each digit may be used only once
Find how many of these 4-digit numbers are even
there are no restrictions,
the team contains all 4 women,
the team contains at least 4 men
A team of 6 people is to be selected from 8 men and 4 women. Find the number of different teams that can be selected if
On the grid below, sketch the graph of \(y = |(x - 2)(x + 3)|\) for \(- 5 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\), and
state the coordinates of the points where the curve meets the coordinate axes
Find the coordinates of the stationary point on the curve \(y = |(x - 2)(x + 3)|.\)
Given that \(k\) is a positive constant, state the set of values of \(k\) for which
\(|(x - 2)(x + 3)| = k\) has 2 solutions only
Differentiate \(4x^{3}\ln (2x + 1)\) with respect to \(x\)
Given that \(y = \frac{2x}{\sqrt{x + 2}}\), show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{x + 4}{(\sqrt{x + 2})^3}\)
Hence find \(\int \frac{5x + 20}{(\sqrt{x + 2})^3} \mathrm{d}x\)
Hence evaluate \(\int_{2}^{7} \frac{5x + 20}{(\sqrt{x + 2})^3} \mathrm{d}x\)
Find the length of the line \(AB\)
The points \(A(- 3, 2)\) and \(B(1, 4)\) are vertices of an isosceles triangle \(ABC\), where angle \(B = 90^\circ\)
Find the equation of the line \(BC\)
Find the coordinates of each of the two possible positions of \(C\)
Solutions to this question by accurate drawing will not be accepted
Find \(\mathbf{A} + 2\mathbf{I}\)
Find \(\mathbf{A}^2\)
Using your answer to part (ii) find the matrix \(\mathbf{B}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^2\mathbf{B} = \mathbf{I}\)
It is given that the matrix \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\)
Given that the matrix \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} x & - 1 \\ x^2 - x + 1 & x - 1 \end{pmatrix}\), show that \(\det \mathbf{C} \neq 0\)
Find the range of f
Write down a suitable domain for f for which \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists
A function f is such that \(\operatorname {f}(x) = 3x^{2} - 1\) for \(- 10 \leqslant x \leqslant 8\)
Find \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\)
Solve \(\mathrm{gh}(x) = 18.\)
Functions g and h are defined by
